title: Resource Area

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Resource Area is a small enclosure located east of the Deserted Keep. It is guarded by Mandrith. An entrance fee of 7,500 coins is required to enter the resource area. If a player logs out while inside the area, players will be brought to the area entrance, and must pay 7,500 coins again to re-enter the area. However, players will only need to pay 6,000 coins to enter if they have completed the medium Wilderness Diary, 3,750 gp if they have completed the hard Wilderness Diary and can enter free of charge if they have completed the elite Wilderness Diary. The mine is one of ten in RuneScape where three iron rocks can be mined without moving, thus ideal for power levelling, with the other nine being the Mining Guild, Legends' Guild mine, Al Kharid Mine, Piscatoris mine, Lovakengj mine, Verdant Valley on Fossil Island, Mount Karuulm mine, Trahaearn mine, and Isle of Souls mine.

content:
Not to be confused with Corsair Cove Resource Area.
Resource Area
Released13 March 2014 (Update)
MembersYes
Floors1
LocationWilderness
InhabitantsRunite Golem
Music• Wilderness tracks
• Moody (Classic mode)
Map

The Resource Area is a small enclosure located east of the Deserted Keep. It is guarded by Mandrith. An entrance fee of 7,500 coins is required to enter the resource area. If a player logs out while inside the area, players will be brought to the area entrance, and must pay 7,500 coins again to re-enter the area. However, players will only need to pay 6,000 coins to enter if they have completed the medium Wilderness Diary, 3,750 gp if they have completed the hard Wilderness Diary and can enter free of charge if they have completed the elite Wilderness Diary. The mine is one of ten in RuneScape where three iron rocks can be mined without moving, thus ideal for power levelling, with the other nine being the Mining Guild, Legends' Guild mine, Al Kharid Mine, Piscatoris mine, Lovakengj mine, Verdant Valley on Fossil Island, Mount Karuulm mine, Trahaearn mine, and Isle of Souls mine.

The resource area contains various Fishing, Woodcutting and Mining resources. An NPC, Piles, will note items obtained within the area for 50 coins per item.

The resource area also contains two Runite Golems, which can be killed then mined for runite ores. There is also a permanent fire, which allows fishers to cook their dark crabs without the need to create a fire. In addition, there is a furnace and anvil within the area.

Players should be warned the area is in the Wilderness, and so players are able to attack them here. It is advised to bring extra coins so players may re-enter the area when logging out to help evade player killers.

The area is unique for being a place where the whole cycle from mining ores to stackable smithing produce can be done within very short distances.

The fastest way to the resource area is the Edgeville Teleport Lever.

There are 5 Wilderness Diary achievements that focus specifically on the Resource Area, although it's possible to complete 7 achievements in the Resource Area since it contains Iron and Mithril rocks.

Contents

  • 1 Entrance fee
  • 2 Resources
  • 3 Rocks
  • 4 Changes

Entrance fee[edit | edit source]

Wilderness Diary Price
None 7,500
Easy 7,500
Medium 6,000
Hard 3,750
Elite Free

Resources[edit | edit source]

Skill Resource(s)
Fishing 4 Dark crab fishing spots
Woodcutting 4 Yew trees, 3 Magic trees

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
3 December 2015
(update)

When removed from the Wilderness resource area by Mandrith, the game message no longer states that you must pay again to regain entry if you have the elite Wilderness diary complete.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

You now get discounted access to the resource area for the completion of Wilderness Diaries:

  • 20% discount for the medium diary.
  • 50% discount for the hard diary.
  • 100% discount (free) for the elite diary.
14 August 2014
(update | poll)

A furnace and anvil have been added to the Wilderness Resource Area & Piles will now note metal bars.

24 April 2014
(update)

The fishing spots in the Resource Area will no longer trigger random events that immediately teleport players out of the area.

{{*}} [[Moody]] (Classic mode) |map = {{Map|name=Resource Area|x=3185|y=3933|height=250|zoom=2}} }} The '''Resource Area''' is a small enclosure located east of the [[Deserted Keep]]. It is guarded by [[Mandrith]]. An entrance fee of 7,500 [[coins]] is required to enter the resource area. If a player logs out while inside the area, players will be brought to the area entrance, and must pay 7,500 coins again to re-enter the area. However, players will only need to pay 6,000 coins to enter if they have completed the medium [[Wilderness Diary]], 3,750 gp if they have completed the hard Wilderness Diary and can enter free of charge if they have completed the elite Wilderness Diary. The [[Mines|mine]] is one of ten in ''[[RuneScape]]'' where three iron rocks can be mined without moving, thus ideal for [[power levelling]], with the other nine being the [[Mining Guild]], [[Legends' Guild mine]], [[Al Kharid Mine]], [[Piscatoris mine]], [[Lovakengj mine]], [[Verdant Valley]] on [[Fossil Island]], [[Mount Karuulm mine]], [[Trahaearn mine]], and [[Isle of Souls mine]]. The resource area contains various [[Fishing]], [[Woodcutting]] and [[Mining]] resources. An NPC, [[Piles]], will note items obtained within the area for 50 [[coins]] per item. The resource area also contains two [[Runite Golem]]s, which can be killed then mined for [[runite ore]]s. There is also a permanent [[fire]], which allows fishers to cook their [[dark crab]]s without the need to create a fire. In addition, there is a [[furnace]] and [[anvil]] within the area. Players should be warned the area is in the [[Wilderness]], and so players are able to attack them here. It is advised to bring extra coins so players may re-enter the area when logging out to help evade [[player killers]]. The area is unique for being a place where the whole cycle from mining ores to stackable smithing produce can be done within very short distances. The fastest way to the resource area is the [[Lever (Edgeville)|Edgeville Teleport Lever]]. There are 5 [[Wilderness Diary]] achievements that focus specifically on the Resource Area, although it's possible to complete 7 achievements in the Resource Area since it contains Iron and Mithril rocks. ==Entrance fee== {| class="wikitable" !Wilderness Diary !Price |- |None |{{Coins|7500}} |- |Easy |{{Coins|7500}} |- |Medium |{{Coins|6000}} |- |Hard |{{Coins|3750}} |- |Elite |{{Yes|Free}} |} ==Resources== {| class="wikitable" !Skill !Resource(s) |- |{{plink|Fishing|pic=Fishing icon}} |4 [[Dark crab]] fishing spots |- |{{plink|Woodcutting|pic=Woodcutting icon}} |4 [[Yew]] trees, 3 [[Magic tree]]s |} ==Rocks== {{Rocktable |NameNotes=(Wilderness) |Iron=6 |Coal=11 |Gold=4 |Mithril=1 |Adamantite=6 }} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 3 December 2015 |update = Skill Cape Perks |change = When removed from the Wilderness resource area by Mandrith, the game message no longer states that you must pay again to regain entry if you have the elite Wilderness diary complete. }} {{Subject changes |date = 5 March 2015 |update = Achievement Diaries |poll = Old School Achievement Diary Rewards Poll |change = You now get discounted access to the resource area for the completion of [[Wilderness Diary|Wilderness Diaries]]: *20% discount for the [[Wilderness Medium|medium diary]]. *50% discount for the [[Wilderness Hard|hard diary]]. *100% discount (free) for the [[Wilderness Elite|elite diary]]. }} {{Subject changes |date = 14 August 2014 |update = The Penance Pet & Super Combat Potions |poll = Old School feature poll - Content Poll 23 |change = A furnace and anvil have been added to the Wilderness Resource Area & Piles will now note metal bars. }} {{Subject changes |date = 24 April 2014 |update = The Motherlode Mine! |change = The fishing spots in the Resource Area will no longer trigger random events that immediately teleport players out of the area. }} {{Subject changes footer}}{{Mines}} [[Category:Wilderness]] [[Category:Locations]]
